column5: A question that I am curious about and was looking for some feedback. Live bait vs artificial bait. I have done numerous fly-in trips to Birch Lake with Kay Air. Half of the guys bring leeches and crawlers, and I am a stubborn crankbait and spinnerbait guy. The live bait guys do well (everyone does well in Birch) I catch just as many fish and probably larger fish than they do. So my question is do we need to take some live bait with us to Whitewater lake? Have never fished it at all. This will be my wife and another couple going. This will be my brides first trip to Canada and I am excited about that! Would love to hear you folks opinions.

Been to whitewater 7 times in the past 16 years and going for my 8th trip there two weeks tomorrow. Never have we used live bait except for the odd leech we caught while swimming or at shore lunch. This year we might order some frozen cisco from the Silver Minnow Bait shop to use for pike bait. You will enjoy your time at whitewater great lake and cabins at MLO.

I'd suggest taking your new bride to see the Wendell Beckwith cabins on Best Island while you are there as a fun little side adventure. While it's still there. http://www.theglobeandmail.com/news/...ticle12418824/
Thanks for the information we are flying in July 8th...would love to hear a fishing report when you return!
Leaving tonight for whitewater. We have preordered leeches to try out.
We are leaving london on the 30 and driving up, we will be fishing from July 1 to july 8. We will most likely see ya on the dock leaving the lake!
I mispoke...we fly in the 9th...but we are staying in the cabins the 8th before we fly out.
